GoalDescription: A nation which utilises and sustainably manages our land, water and natural resources
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Promote the sustainable development of the fisheries sector that values the protection and conservation of marine and freshwater resources
IndicatorDescription: Number of integrated coastal management plans developed and implemented
ComputationMethod: Number of Integrated Coastal Zone Management Plans (ICZM)
Concept: Integrated coastal zone management (ICZM) is the process for managing all coastal issues in a framework integrated across biota and habitats, time and space, and levels of government
DataSource:
* Department of Environment (Administrative Data)
 * Department of Fisheries (Administrative Data)
*Fisheries Department,
Definition: Integrated coastal zone management (ICZM) or Integrated coastal management (ICM) is a process for the management of the coast using an integrated approach, regarding all aspects of the coastal zone, including geographical and political boundaries, in an attempt to achieve sustainability
Dissaggregation:
* Area Council Level
* Rural/Urban
* Provincial Level
* National Level
IndicatorShortName: Development and Implementation of Integrated Coastal Management Plans
Rationale: ICZM is a dynamic, multidisciplinary and iterative process to promote sustainable management of coastal zones. It covers the full cycle of information collection, planning (in its broadest sense), decision-making, management and monitoring of implementation
TargetDescription: 40 integrated coastal management plans developed and operational
